lustre/tests/runas.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00035 #include <stdio.h>
00036 #include <stdlib.h>
00037 #include <unistd.h>
00038 #include <string.h>
00039 #include <errno.h>
00040 #include <ctype.h>
00041 #include <sys/types.h>
00042 #include <pwd.h>
00043 #include <grp.h>
00044 #include <sys/wait.h>
00045 
00046 #define DEBUG 0
00047 
00048 #ifndef NGROUPS_MAX
00049 #define NGROUPS_MAX 32
00050 #endif
00051 
00052 static const char usage[] =
00053 "Usage: %s -u user_id [-g grp_id] [-v euid] [-j egid] [-G[gid0,gid1,...]] command\n"
00054 "  -u user_id           switch to UID user_id\n"
00055 "  -g grp_id            switch to GID grp_id\n"
00056 "  -v euid              switch euid to UID\n"
00057 "  -j egid              switch egid to GID\n"
00058 "  -G[gid0,gid1,...]    set supplementary groups\n";
00059 
00060 void Usage_and_abort(const char *name)
00061 {
00062         fprintf(stderr, usage, name);
00063         exit(-1);
00064 }
00065 
00066 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00067 {
00068         char **my_argv, *name = argv[0], *grp;
00069         int status, c, i;
00070         int gid_is_set = 0, uid_is_set = 0, num_supp = -1;
00071         uid_t user_id = 0;
00072         gid_t grp_id = 0, supp_groups[NGROUPS_MAX] = { 0 };
00073         int euid_is_set = 0, egid_is_set = 0;
00074         uid_t euid = 0;
00075         gid_t egid = 0;
00076 
00077         if (argc == 1) {
00078                 fprintf(stderr, "No parameter count\n");
00079                 Usage_and_abort(name);
00080         }
00081 
00082         // get UID and GID
00083         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "+u:g:v:j:hG::")) != -1) {
00084                 switch (c) {
00085                 case 'u':
00086                         if (!isdigit(optarg[0])) {
00087                                 struct passwd *pw = getpwnam(optarg);
00088                                 if (pw == NULL) {
00089                                         fprintf(stderr, "parameter '%s' bad\n",
00090                                                 optarg);
00091                                         Usage_and_abort(name);
00092                                 }
00093                                 user_id = pw->pw_uid;
00094                         } else {
00095                                 user_id = (uid_t)atoi(optarg);
00096                         }
00097                         uid_is_set = 1;
00098                         if (!gid_is_set)
00099                                 grp_id = user_id;
00100                         break;
00101 
00102                 case 'g':
00103                         if (!isdigit(optarg[0])) {
00104                                 struct group *gr = getgrnam(optarg);
00105                                 if (gr == NULL) {
00106                                         fprintf(stderr, "getgrname %s failed\n",
00107                                                 optarg);
00108                                         Usage_and_abort(name);
00109                                 }
00110                                 grp_id = gr->gr_gid;
00111                         } else {
00112                                 grp_id = (gid_t)atoi(optarg);
00113                         }
00114                         gid_is_set = 1;
00115                         break;
00116 
00117                 case 'v':
00118                         if (!isdigit(optarg[0])) {
00119                                 struct passwd *pw = getpwnam(optarg);
00120                                 if (pw == NULL) {
00121                                         fprintf(stderr, "parameter '%s' bad\n",
00122                                                 optarg);
00123                                         Usage_and_abort(name);
00124                                 }
00125                                 euid = pw->pw_uid;
00126                         } else {
00127                                 euid = (uid_t)atoi(optarg);
00128                         }
00129                         euid_is_set = 1;
00130                         break;
00131 
00132                 case 'j':
00133                         if (!isdigit(optarg[0])) {
00134                                 struct group *gr = getgrnam(optarg);
00135                                 if (gr == NULL) {
00136                                         fprintf(stderr, "getgrname %s failed\n",
00137                                                 optarg);
00138                                         Usage_and_abort(name);
00139                                 }
00140                                 egid = gr->gr_gid;
00141                         } else {
00142                                 egid = (gid_t)atoi(optarg);
00143                         }
00144                         egid_is_set = 1;
00145                         break;
00146 
00147                 case 'G':
00148                         num_supp = 0;
00149                         if (optarg == NULL || !isdigit(optarg[0]))
00150                                 break;
00151                         while ((grp = strsep(&optarg, ",")) != NULL) {
00152                                 printf("adding supp group %d\n", atoi(grp));
00153                                 supp_groups[num_supp++] = atoi(grp);
00154                                 if (num_supp >= NGROUPS_MAX)
00155                                         break;
00156                         }
00157                         break;
00158 
00159                 default:
00160                 case 'h':
00161                         Usage_and_abort(name);
00162                         break;
00163                 }
00164         }
00165 
00166         if (!uid_is_set) {
00167                 fprintf(stderr, "Must specify uid to run.\n");
00168                 Usage_and_abort(name);
00169         }
00170 
00171         if (optind == argc) {
00172                 fprintf(stderr, "Must specify command to run.\n");
00173                 Usage_and_abort(name);
00174         }
00175 
00176         // assemble the command
00177         my_argv = (char**)malloc(sizeof(char*)*(argc+1-optind));
00178         if (my_argv == NULL) {
00179                 fprintf(stderr, "Error in allocating memory. (%s)\n",
00180                         strerror(errno));
00181                 exit(-1);
00182         }
00183 
00184         for (i = optind; i < argc; i++) {
00185                 my_argv[i-optind] = argv[i];
00186                 //printf("%s\n",my_argv[i-optind]);
00187         }
00188         my_argv[i-optind] = NULL;
00189 
00190 #if DEBUG
00191         system("whoami");
00192 #endif
00193 
00194         // set GID
00195         if (!egid_is_set)
00196                 egid = grp_id;
00197         status = setregid(grp_id, egid);
00198         if (status == -1) {
00199                  fprintf(stderr, "Cannot change gid to %d/%d, errno=%d (%s)\n",
00200                          grp_id, egid, errno, strerror(errno) );
00201                  exit(-1);
00202         }
00203 
00204         if (num_supp >= 0) {
00205                 status = setgroups(num_supp, supp_groups);
00206                 if (status == -1) {
00207                         perror("setting supplementary groups");
00208                         exit(-1);
00209                 }
00210         }
00211 
00212         // set UID
00213         if (!euid_is_set)
00214                 euid = user_id;
00215         status = setreuid(user_id, euid);
00216         if(status == -1) {
00217                   fprintf(stderr,"Cannot change uid to %d/%d, errno=%d (%s)\n",
00218                            user_id, euid, errno, strerror(errno) );
00219                   exit(-1);
00220         }
00221 
00222         fprintf(stderr, "running as uid/gid/euid/egid %d/%d/%d/%d, groups:",
00223                 user_id, grp_id, euid, egid);
00224         for (i = 0; i < num_supp; i++)
00225                 fprintf(stderr, " %d", supp_groups[i]);
00226         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00227 
00228         for (i = 0; i < argc - optind; i++)
00229                  fprintf(stderr, " [%s]", my_argv[i]);
00230 
00231         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00232         fflush(stderr);
00233 
00234         // The command to be run
00235         execvp(my_argv[0], my_argv);
00236         fprintf(stderr, "execvp fails running %s (%d): %s\n", my_argv[0],
00237                 errno, strerror(errno));
00238         exit(-1);
00239 }
